00021 #define SPACES " \t\r\n"
00022 
00023 inline string trimRight (const string & s, const string & t = SPACES)
00024 {
00025     string d (s);
00026     string::size_type i (d.find_last_not_of (t));
00027 
00028     if (i == string::npos)
00029         return "";
00030     else
00031         return d.erase (d.find_last_not_of (t) + 1);
00032 }
00033 
00034 inline void trimRightSelf (string & d, const string & t = SPACES)
00035 {
00036     string::size_type i (d.find_last_not_of (t));
00037 
00038     if (i != string::npos)
00039         d.erase (d.find_last_not_of (t) + 1);
00040 }
00041 
00042 inline string trimLeft (const string & s, const string & t = SPACES)
00043 {
00044     string d (s);
00045     return d.erase (0, s.find_first_not_of (t));
00046 }
00047 
00048 inline void trimLeftSelf (string & d, const string & t = SPACES)
00049 {
00050     d.erase (0, d.find_first_not_of (t));
00051 }
00052 
00053 
00054 inline string trim (const string & s, const string & t = SPACES)
00055 {
00056     string d (s);
00057     return trimLeft (trimRight (d, t), t);
00058 }
00059 
00060 inline void trimSelf (string & d, const string & t = SPACES)
00061 {
00062     trimRightSelf (d, t);
00063     trimLeftSelf (d, t);
00064 }

00066 // returns a lower case version of the string
00067 inline string toLower (const string & s)
00068 {
00069     string d (s);
00070     transform (d.begin (), d.end (), d.begin (), (int(*)(int)) tolower);
00071     return d;
00072 }
00073 
00074 // returns a lower case version of the string
00075 inline void toLowerSelf(string & d)
00076 {
00077     //transform (d.begin (), d.end (), d.begin (), (int(*)(int)) tolower);
00078     
00079     string::iterator itr = d.begin();
00080     size_t size = d.length();
00081     for(size_t i = 0; i < size; ++i)
00082     {
00083         *itr = tolower( *itr );
00084         ++itr;
00085     }
00086 
00087 /*
00088     size_t size = d.length();
00089     for(size_t i = 0; i < size; ++i)
00090     {
00091         d[i] = tolower(d[i]);
00092     }*/
00093 }

00095 // returns an upper case version of the string
00096 inline string toUpper (const string & s)
00097 {
00098     string d (s);
00099     transform (d.begin (), d.end (), d.begin (), (int(*)(int)) toupper);
00100     return d;
00101 }

00103 // transformation function for toCapitals that has a "state"
00104 // so it can capitalise a sequence
00105 class fCapitals : public unary_function<char,char>
00106 {
00107     bool bUpper;
00108 
00109 public:
00110 
00111     // first letter in string will be in capitals
00112     fCapitals () : bUpper (true) {}; // constructor
00113 
00114     char operator() (const char & c)
00115     {
00116         char c1;
00117         // capitalise depending on previous letter
00118         if (bUpper)
00119             c1 = toUpper (c+"").at(0);
00120         else
00121             c1 = toLower (c+"").at(0);
00122 
00123         // work out whether next letter should be capitals
00124         bUpper = isalnum (c) == 0;
00125         return c1;
00126     }
00127 };
00128 
00129 // returns a capitalized version of the string
00130 inline string toCapitals (const string & s)
00131 {
00132     string d (s);
00133     transform (d.begin (), d.end (), d.begin (), fCapitals ());
00134     return d;
00135 }

00137 // replace first str2 in str1 with str3
00138 inline bool replace(string& str1, const string& str2, const string& str3)
00139 {
00140     if (str1.size() == 0 || str2.size() == 0)
00141         return false;
00142 
00143     if (str1.size() < str2.size())
00144         return false;
00145 
00146     size_t pos = str1.find(str2);
00147     if (pos == string::npos)
00148         return false;
00149     str1.replace(pos, str2.size(), str3);
00150     return true;
00151 }
00152 
00153 // replace first str2 in str1 with str3
00154 inline bool replaceAll(string& str1, const string& str2, const string& str3)
00155 {
00156     if(str2 == str3)
00157         return false;
00158     unsigned int count = 0;
00159 
00160     while (replace(str1, str2, str3))
00161         ++count;
00162 
00163     return count != 0;
00164 }

00166 // split a line into the first word, and rest-of-the-line
00167 inline string getWord (string& s, const string delim = " ", const bool trim_spaces = true)
00168 {
00169     // find delimiter
00170     string::size_type i (s.find (delim));
00171 
00172     // split into before and after delimiter
00173     string w (s.substr (0, i));
00174 
00175 
00176     if (i == string::npos) // if no delimiter, remainder is empty
00177         s.erase ();
00178     else // erase up to the delimiter
00179         s.erase (0, i + delim.size ());
00180 
00181     // trim spaces if required
00182     if (trim_spaces)
00183     {
00184         w = trim (w);
00185         s = trim (s);
00186     }
00187 
00188     // return first word in line
00189     return w;
00190 
00191 }
00192 
00193 // To be symmetric, we assume an empty string (after trimming spaces)
00194 // will give an empty vector.
00195 // However, a non-empty string (with no delimiter) will give one item
00196 // After that, you get an item per delimiter, plus 1.
00197 // eg.  ""      => empty
00198 //      "a"     => 1 item
00199 //      "a,b"   => 2 items
00200 //      "a,b,"  => 3 items (last one empty)
00201 
00202 inline void stringToVector (const string s, vector<string> & v, const string delim = " ", const bool trim_spaces = true)
00203 {
00204     // start with initial string, trimmed of leading/trailing spaces if required
00205     string s1 (trim_spaces ? trim (s) : s);
00206 
00207     // ensure vector empty
00208     v.clear ();
00209 
00210     // no string? no elements
00211     if (s1.empty ())
00212         return;
00213 
00214     // add to vector while we have a delimiter
00215     while (!s1.empty () && s1.find (delim) != string::npos)
00216         v.push_back (getWord (s1, delim, trim_spaces));
00217 
00218     // add final element
00219     v.push_back (s1);
00220 }
00221 
00222 // Takes a vector of strings and converts it to a string
00223 // like "apples,peaches,pears"
00224 // Should be symmetric with stringToVector (excepting any spaces that might have
00225 //  been trimmed).
00226 
00227 inline string vectorToString (const vector<string> & v, const string delim = " ")
00228 {
00229     // vector empty gives empty string
00230     if (v.empty ())
00231         return "";
00232 
00233     // for copying results into
00234     ostringstream os;
00235 
00236     // copy all but last one, with delimiter after each one
00237     copy (v.begin (), v.end () - 1,
00238           ostream_iterator<string> (os, delim.c_str ()));
00239 
00240     // return string with final element appended
00241     return os.str () + *(v.end () - 1);
00242 }
00243 
00244 inline string depTrim (const string & s, const string & t = SPACES)
00245 {
00246         string ret;
00247         vector<string> v;
00248         stringToVector(s, v, t, true);
00249 
00250         bool add_space = false;
00251         vector<string>::iterator idx = v.begin();
00252         vector<string>::iterator end = v.end();
00253         for(; idx!=end; ++idx)
00254         {
00255                 ret += *idx;
00256 
00257                 if(add_space)
00258                         ret += " ";
00259                 else
00260                         add_space = true;
00261         }
00262 
00263         return ret;
00264 }

00266 inline void tokenizeAndLowerCase(vector<string>& vec, string text, const char* delimiter){
00267     string::size_type last = 0;
00268     string::size_type next = 0;
00269     string::size_type dellen = strlen(delimiter);
00270     string::size_type strlen = text.size();
00271     while(last < strlen){
00272         next = text.find_first_of(delimiter, last);
00273         if(next == string::npos){
00274             next = strlen;
00275         }
00276         string tmp = text.substr(last, next-last);
00277         trimSelf(tmp);
00278         if(tmp.size() > 0){
00279             toLowerSelf(tmp);
00280             vec.push_back(tmp);
00281         }
00282         last = next + dellen;
00283     }
00284 
00285 }

00287 static const string PUNTCUATION = " ,./<>?;':\"[]\\{}|~!@#$%^&*()_+`-=";
00288 
00289 inline size_t computeLength(const string& str, bool isWordLan){
00290     if(!isWordLan)
00291         return str.size();
00292     unsigned int count = 0;
00293     bool notpunc = false; //true if occur one notpunc
00294     for(string::const_iterator itr = str.begin(); itr != str.end(); ++itr){
00295         if(PUNTCUATION.find_first_of(*itr, 0) != string::npos){
00296             if(notpunc){
00297                 ++count;
00298                 notpunc = false;
00299             }
00300 
00301             ++count;
00302         }else{
00303             notpunc = true;
00304         }
00305     }
00306 
00307     if(notpunc){
00308         ++count;
00309     }
00310 
00311     return count;
00312 }
00313 
00314 inline vector<size_t>* findTokens(const string& str, bool isWordLan){
00315     vector<size_t> *ret = new vector<size_t>();
00316     ret->push_back(0);
00317     size_t len = str.length();
00318     if(!isWordLan){
00319         for(size_t i=0;i<len;++i){
00320             ret->push_back(i);
00321         }
00322         return ret;
00323     }
00324 
00325     bool notpunc = false; //true if occur one notpunc
00326     size_t length = str.length();
00327     for(size_t i=0; i<length; ++i){
00328         if(PUNTCUATION.find_first_of(str[i], 0) != string::npos){
00329             if(notpunc){
00330                 ret->push_back(i-1);
00331                 notpunc = false;
00332             }
00333             ret->push_back(i);
00334         }else{
00335             notpunc = true;
00336         }
00337     }
00338 
00339     if(notpunc){
00340         ret->push_back(length-1);
00341     }
00342     return ret;
00343 }
